content.text: a base unit and a number
a unit and a number expressed in standard form (scientific notation)
a unit and a numerical magnitude
an SI unit and a numerical magnitude
What is needed to accurately represent all physical quantities?
A voltmeter connected across a resistor in a circuit reads 3.6 V
What could be the current in the resistor and the resistance of the resistor?

table.html:
currentresistance
A150 mA0.24 kΩ
B15 mA2.4 kΩ
C1.5 mA0.24 MΩ

content.text: In an experiment to determine the acceleration of free fall \(g\), the time \(t\) taken for a ball to fall through distance \(s\) is measured. The percentage uncertainty in the measurement of \(s\) is \(2\%\). The percentage uncertainty in the measurement of \(t\) is \(3\%\)
The value of \(g\) is determined using the equation shown
What is the percentage uncertainty in the calculated value of \(g?\)
momentum
speed
temperature
Young modulus
Which quantity is a vector?
A particle accelerates from rest
The graph shows the variation of the velocity \(\nu\) of the particle with time \(t\)
Which graph shows the variation of the velocity \(\nu\) with the acceleration \(a\) of the particle?
The graph shows the vertical velocity of a parachutist during the first 20 s of her jump
Approximately how far does she fall **before** opening the parachute?
force per unit time
product of force and time
product of velocity and mass
velocity per unit mass
What is the definition of linear momentum?

A mass of \(0.20 \text{kg}\) is suspended from the lower end of a light spring. A second mass of \(0.10 \text{kg}\) is suspended from the first mass by a thread. The arrangement is allowed to come into static equilibrium and then the thread is cut
Immediately after the thread is cut, what is the upward acceleration of the \(0.20 \text{kg}\) mass?
The raindrop takes more time than the snowflake to reach terminal velocity
The raindrop takes more time than the snowflake to reach the ground
They reach the same terminal velocity
They take the same amount of time to reach the ground
A snowflake and a raindrop are in still air. They both fall from rest at the same time and from the same height, far above the ground

The snowflake and raindrop contain the same mass of water. Assume that there is no evaporation or melting. Also assume that, for a given speed, the drag force acting on the snowflake is greater than the drag force acting on the raindrop
Which statement about the snowflake and raindrop is correct?
4J
6J
8J
Two trolleys are held together on a horizontal surface with a compressed spring between them
When they are released, the trolleys lose contact with the spring. The trolley of mass \(2\mathrm{kg}\) moves to the left at a final speed of \(2\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\)
How much elastic potential energy was stored in the spring?
\(\frac{\mathrm{x}}{\sqrt{2}}\)
x
A square board, of side length \(x\), hangs freely from a nail P, as shown
The board has uniform thickness and is made from material of uniform density

A second square board, of side length \(2\mathrm{x}\), is made of the same material and has the same thickness as the original board. This second board is then hung from a nail Q. Nails P and Q are at the same height
What is the vertical distance between the positions of the centres of gravity of the two boards?
Forces are applied to a rigid object. The forces all act in the same plane
In which diagram is the object in equilibrium?

A rigid rod XY has negligible mass and length \(75\mathrm{cm}\). The rod is suspended from a fixed point P by a string attached to end X. An object of mass \(11\mathrm{kg}\) is suspended by a string that is attached to the rod at a distance of \(25\mathrm{cm}\) from end X, as shown
Which vertically upward force acting on end Y of the rod would hold the rod horizontally in equilibrium?
40 cm³
44 cm³
52 cm³
80 cm³
The density of water is \(1.0 \text{g} \text{cm}^{-3}\) and the density of glycerine is \(1.3 \text{g} \text{cm}^{-3}\)

Water is added to a measuring cylinder containing \(40 \text{cm}^3\) of glycerine so that the density of the mixture is \(1.1 \text{g} \text{cm}^{-3}\). Assume that the mixing process does not change the total volume of the liquid
What is the volume of water added?
A box, in the shape of a cube, falls from a ship into the sea. The box lands with its lower face level with the surface of the sea
box on the
surface of the sea surface of sea
The box begins to sink, becomes totally submerged and then sinks deeper into the sea
As the box sinks, its lower face is always parallel to the surface of the sea
Which graph best represents the variation of the upthrust acting on the box with the depth of its lower face below the surface of the sea?
The spring gains both gravitational potential energy and elastic potential energy
The spring gains gravitational potential energy and loses elastic potential energy
The spring loses both gravitational potential energy and elastic potential energy
The spring loses gravitational potential energy and gains elastic potential energy
A spring is compressed by a mass, as shown
Which statement describes the changes to the energy of the spring when it is compressed by the mass?
A man of mass \(75\mathrm{kg}\) runs up a staircase consisting of 30 steps. Each step is \(20\mathrm{cm}\) high
The man takes a time of 7.0 s to run from the bottom of the staircase to the top
What is the average rate of increase of gravitational potential energy of the man?
An alpha-particle has \(2.2 \times 10^{-13} \text{J}\) of kinetic energy
What is the speed of the alpha-particle?
Identical springs are joined in four arrangements
Which arrangement has the same spring constant as a single spring?
3.0 cm
5.0 cm
6.0 cm
8.0 cm
An unstretched spring has a length of 2.0 cm
The spring is then stretched within its limit of proportionality by a tensile force of \(1.5 \text{N}\) so that the elastic potential energy stored in the spring is \(0.045 \text{J}\)
What is the stretched length of the spring?
Amplitude is proportional to wavelength
Frequency is inversely proportional to wavelength
Intensity is proportional to amplitude squared at a given frequency
Period is equal to the reciprocal of frequency
A signal generator, amplifier and loudspeaker are used to produce different sound waves in the air of a room. The relationships between the properties of these waves are investigated
Which relationship is **not** correct?
430 Hz
680 Hz
When a guitar string is plucked, it causes a longitudinal sound wave in the air, as shown
The speed of sound in the air is \(340 \text{m s}^{-1}\)
What is the approximate frequency of the sound wave shown?
A transverse wave travels along a rope. The diagram shows the rope at time \(t = 0\)
The wave is travelling from left to right. The period of the wave is \(T\)
One particle of the rope is labelled X
Which graph shows the variation with time of the displacement of particle X between \(t = 0\) and \(t = 2T\)?
56 Hz
180 Hz
400 Hz
500 Hz

A jet aircraft travels at a speed of \(0.80\nu\), where \(\nu\) is the speed of sound. The aircraft directly approaches a stationary observer. The frequency of sound emitted by the aircraft is \(100 \text{Hz}\)
Which frequency does the observer hear?
microwave telescope
optical telescope
radio telescope
X-ray telescope
A telescope detects and analyses some electromagnetic radiation of wavelength 2 cm
Which type of telescope is it?
always
only when the waves have the same amplitude
only when the waves have the same frequency
only when the waves travel in opposite directions
Two waves of the same type overlap
When does the principle of superposition apply?
A stationary sound wave is formed in a tube of length \(L\) that is closed at one end
The diagram shows the positions of the nodes and antinodes of the stationary wave
Which graph shows the variation of the amplitude \(a\) of the wave with distance \(x\) measured from the closed end of the tube?
Less diffraction is observed
More diffraction is observed
There is no diffraction
The same amount of diffraction is observed
A wave on the surface of water passes through a gap between two barriers and is diffracted, as shown
What happens when the frequency of the wave is halved?
The bright fringes and the dark fringes all become brighter
The bright fringes and the dark fringes all become darker
The bright fringes become brighter and the dark fringes become darker
The bright fringes become darker and the dark fringes become brighter
Observable interference fringes are produced using light from a double slit. The intensity of the light emerging from each slit is initially the same
The intensity of the light emerging from one of the slits is now reduced
How does this affect the interference pattern?
A diffraction grating has \(4.00 \times 10^{5}\) lines per metre. A beam of light of wavelength \(589 \times 10^{-9} \text{m}\) is incident normally on the diffraction grating
What is the angle between the second-order maximum and the direction of the incident beam of light?
Q
Q
Q
Q
A length of wire RS has a circular cross-section
At end R of the wire, the cross-sectional area is \(A\)
At end S of the wire, the cross-sectional area is \(\frac{A}{2}\)
Charge Q takes time \(t\) to pass through end R of the wire. There is a constant electric current in the wire
How much charge will pass through end S in a time interval of \(\frac{t}{4}\) ?
1.6 kJ
11 kJ
A power supply is connected to a component by connecting wires of total resistance \(4.9 \Omega\)
The power supply has an output power of \(3.6 \text{W}\) and a terminal potential difference of \(12 \text{V}\)
How much thermal energy is dissipated in the connecting wires in a time of 1.0 hour?
A copper wire is to be replaced by an aluminium alloy wire of the same length and resistance. Copper has half the resistivity of the alloy
What is the ratio
diameter of alloy wire \(\frac{\text{diameter of copper wire}}{\text{diameter of copper wire}}\) ?
Three identical filament lamps, P, Q and R, are connected to a battery of negligible internal resistance, as shown
The filament wire in lamp Q breaks so that it no longer conducts
What are the changes in the brightness of lamps P and R?
charge per unit energy transferred
charge per unit time
energy transferred per unit charge
energy transferred per unit time
Which ratio has the same units as electromotive force (e.m.f.)?
A circuit consists of a battery, a voltmeter and five fixed resistors, as shown
The voltmeter reading is zero
What is the resistance of resistor R?
Decrease the temperature of the thermistor
Increase the resistance of the variable resistor
Reduce the intensity of light incident on the light-dependent resistor (LDR)
Replace the fixed resistor with a \(500\Omega\) resistor
A battery of electromotive force (e.m.f.) 6.0 V and negligible internal resistance is connected to a voltmeter and four other components, as shown
The voltmeter is connected between points X and Y. The positive terminal of the voltmeter is connected to X and the negative terminal of the voltmeter is connected to Y
Initially, the resistance of each of the four components is \(1.0 \text{k}\Omega\)
Which change, on its own, will cause the voltmeter to show a positive reading?
charge
momentum
nucleon number
proton number
An \(\alpha \)-particle passes close to a gold nucleus and is deflected through an angle greater than \(90^{\circ}\)
Which property of the \(\alpha \)-particle changes as a result of the deflection?
A nucleus of \(^{238}_{92}\mathrm{U}\) decays in stages by emitting \(\alpha\) -particles and \(\beta^{- }\) particles, eventually forming a nucleus of \(^{206}_{82}\mathrm{Pb}\)
How many \(\alpha\)-particles and how many \(\beta^{- }\) particles are emitted during the decay chain?
antineutrino, beta, meson
baryon, neutrino, positron
electron, neutrino, alpha
lepton, quark, positron
Which list of particles contains **only** fundamental particles?
